intro: Dipteranthemum crosslandii, commonly known as the Crossland's dipteranthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
